summary: I BOUGHT MY YOUNGEST SON A 1992 SUBARU LEGACY STATION WAGON. I WENT TO FILL THE GAS TANK AND WHEN I GOT HOME YOU COULD SMELL GAS FUMES VERY STRONGLY AND LATER WE COULD SEE WHERE IT HAD LEAKED ONTO THE GROUND. I ASKED MY OLDEST SON ABOUT IT SINCE HE IS A CERTIFIED MECHANIC AND HE WAS TELLING ME ABOUT A RECALL ON THAT YEAR BECAUSE OF HOW THE COMPANY PUT IN THE BACK SEAT. I CONTACTED MY LOCAL SUBARU DEALER  (KELLY CADILLAC) AND THEY SAID IT WAS NOT THAT YEAR OR VIN NUMBER AND THAT THEY COULD NOT HELP ME. THEY ACTED LIKE IF IT WAS NOT A NEW VEHICLE THEN IT DID NOT MATTER. THIS IS MY SON'S ONLY WAY TO COLLEGE EVERY DAY BUT IT WORRIES ME WHETHER THIS CAR IS SAFE OR NOT.  *TR

CRACKS APPEAR IN CIRCUMFERENTIAL SIPES AFTER 9,000 MILES / 1 YR 10 MO.  THIS OCCURRED IN ALL 4 TIRES. SNOWY NORTHEAST CLIMATE, PROPERLY INFLATED TO 29-30 PSI.  SIMILAR CRACKING OCCURRED ON IDENTICAL TIRE MODEL ALMOST 2 YRS AGO (DOT # ANRBMC112705), ALSO IN ALL 4 TIRES AFTER 10,000 MILES / 2 YEARS.  PREVIOUS TIRES, AND THESE TIRES, WERE DIFFERENT LOTS.  BF GOODRICH TRACTION T/A.  NO CATASTROPHIC FAILURE EITHER TIME - FOUND ON STATE INSPECTION. *TR

1) TRAVELING ON I-10 WEST APPROACHING WILCOX, AZ. PASSED UP DIESEL, DIESEL CROSSED INTO LANE (POSSIBLY DUE TO HEAVY CROSSWINDS PROMINENT IN AREA), LOST CONTROL OF CAR AND ROLLED TWICE OFF THE HIGHWAY.  2) ROOF CAVED IN ON DRIVERS SIDE, CAUSING A COMPRESSING FRACTURE TO DRIVERS NECK.  DRIVER NOW PARALYZED FROM NECK DOWN.  DRIVER IS APPROXIMATELY 5'0 TALL SO AMOUNT OF DAMAGE DONE IS UNACCEPTABLE.  CAR WAS TRAVELING ABOUT 45 MPH WHEN CAR ROLLED OVER (SPEED LOST WHILE TRYING TO GAIN CONTROL OF VEHICLE)  3) VEHICLE TOTALLED
WHILE DRIVING IN STOP AND GO TRAFFIC AND UPON PUTTING FOOT ON THE CLUTCH AND THE BRAKES VEHICLE SURGED FORWARD.  IT FELT LIKE THE VEHICLE WAS TRYING TO PUSH SOMETHING VERY HEAVY OUT OF THE WAY.  *AK

WHILE DRIVING 65 MPH  TRANSMISSION FAILED WITHOUT WARNING. AS A RESULT  VEHICLE LOST POWER, FORCING DRIVER TO VEER OFF THE ROAD. DEALER STATED THAT TRANSMISSION BREATHING VENTS WERE BLOCKED DUE TO FLUID FREEZING. A RECALL   94V052000 WAS ISSUED,HOWEVER THIS VEHICLE WAS NOT INCLUDED DUE TO VIN.  *AK

THE VEHICLE WAS INVOLVED IN ACCIDENT, CONSUMER TOOK VEHICLE TO BE REPAIRED.  DEALERSHIP PRESENTED VEHICLE REPAIRS AS COMPLETE, CONSUMER DISAGREED.*MR  REAR GATE RELOCATED.   SWITCH CONTROLLING CARGO LAMP AND STATUS PANEL DID NOT FUNCTION.  FRONT BUMPER WAS GROSSLY MISALIGNED.  FRONT BUMPER TO RIGHT FRONT FENDER MISMATCHED.  REAR WIPER PIVOT COVER  WAS MISSING.  EXHAUST TIPS ROTATED.  BUMPER REINFORCEMENT BRACKETS WERE MISSING.  REAR TAIL LAMP SETTING OUT FROM BODY.  GATE HINGE BOLT FELL OUT.  INNER SKIRT WAS BOWED IN.  GAP IN RIGHT REAR DOOR.  VAPOR CANISTER IN THE ENGINE COMPARTMENT WAS LEFT LOOSE.  DRAIN HOSE NOT CONNECTED.  TIRE UNDER-INFLATED.   FLOOR DATUM POINTS LEFT UNDONE.   REAR HATCH OPENING WEATHERSTRIP WAS IMPROPERLY SEALED.    *TT  *JB

SEVERAL TULSA DEALERS UNABLE/UNWILLING TO REPAIR SMALL NAIL PUNCTURE OF FT70C TIRE.  STATE "THIS TIRE NOT MADE TO BE REPAIRED-SELF SEALING" CONTINUAL LOSS OF AIR NECESSITATES CONSTANT REFILLING.  PREVIOUS TIRE REPAIRED BY CERTIFIED TIRE SERVICE FACILITY SHOWED SIDEWALL SEPARATION USING ACCEPTABLE REPAIR EQUIPMENT.  TIRE MAKE HAS BEEN DISCONTINUED. NOW MANUFACTURED UNDER DIFFERENT MODEL DESIGNATION.  *NLM
MICHELIN TIRES KEEP BLOWING OUT. THE SIDEWALLS ARE SEPARATING FROM THE TIRES.      PH

I NEED YOUR HELP TO FIX A PROBLEM GONE ON FAR TOO LONG. MY SUBARU SVX TRANSMISSION SUFFERS WITH A DELAY WHEN SHIFTING GEARS, HIGH REVS AND SLIPPING WHILE SHIFTING AND A CLUNKING WHEN PUTTING THE CAR IN REVERSE. THE HEAT TRANSMISSION INSTALLED IN THE SUBARU SVX AND LEGACY MODELS SUFFER FROM A SEVERE COOLING PROBLEM. THE RADIATOR BASED TRANSMISSION COOLER CAN NOT COOL THE TRANSMISSION FLUID COOL ENOUGH. THE TRANSMISSIONS POOR DESIGN DOES NOT ALLOW THE LUBRICANT TO FLOW THROUGH IT TO KEEP PARTS LUBRICATED(THUS MORE FRICTION AND HEAT DAMAGE). UNUSUAL HIGH OVERDRIVE PLACES ADDITIONAL SIDE LOADS ON BEARINGS GENERATING HEAT. THE ALL-WHEEL-DRIVE SYSTEM PUTS EVEN MORE STRAIN ON THE TRANSMISSION CAUSING EVEN MORE HEAT. THIS PROBLEM IS OF EPIDEMIC PROPORTION SO COMMON AMONG OVER 90% OF THESE CARS MANUFACTURED. SUBARU IS AWARE OF THE MANUFACTURING AND ENGINEERING DEFECTS IN THE TRANSMISSIONS FOR ALL SVX MODELS.  ALMOST ALL SVX OWNERS, EVERY WEBSITE, AND EVEN YOUR OWN COMPLAINT FILES ARE AWARE OF THIS MAJOR DEFECT AND  SPECIFIC PROBLEMS WITH THE TRANSMISSIONS. SUBARU HAS DONE NOTHING IF ANYTHING TO CORRECT THIS PROBLEM. THIS PROBLEM IS WIDESPREAD AND THE MANUFACTURER KNOWS ABOUT IT.  AT THE VERY LEAST I NEED SUBARU TO REPLACE MY DEFECTIVE TRANSMISSION  WITH A NEW ONE UPGRADED WITH HIGH CLUTCH DRUM AND THRUST BEARINGS, NEW REVERSE CLUTCH STEEL PLATES, MODIFIED TRANSMISSION CASE,  OIL PUMP GASKET AND TRANSFER CLUTCH DRIVEN PLATE, A TRANSMISSION OIL FILTER KIT AND AN AFTER TRANSMISSION OIL COOLER AND WARRANTY IT. THIS CAR IS TOO EXPENSIVE TO FIX THE DAMAGE FROM THEIR DEFECTIVE DESIGN AND UNUSUALLY HIGH COST COMPARED TO OTHER TRANSMISSIONS.  DT
CONSUMER STATES THAT WHILE DRIVING AT ANY SPEED AND NO WARNING THE VEHICLE WILL SHUT OFF CAUSING CONSUMER TO PULL OVER AND IT WILL BE HARD TO GET THE VEHICLE BACK STARTED. DEALER NOTIFIED.  MR
ENGINE QUITS ON HILLS WHEN SHIFTING INTO A HIGHER GEAR AT ABOUT 35 MPH.  ENGINE ALSO QUITS AT ABOUT 40 MPH, AGAIN WHEN RPM ABOUT 3000 ON A COLD ENGINE.*AK

IN THE CAR'S MANUAL AND, FROM WHAT I'VE HEARD FROM TALKING WITH FRIENDS, THERE IS A FUSE UNDER THE HOOD OF THE CAR THAT ALLOWS YOU TO SWITCH FROM 4WD/AWD TO FWD FOR TOWING ETC.  MY CAR LACKS THIS FUSE/HOLDER AND IF IT WERE TO EVER BE TOWED THE TRANSMISSION COULD BE DAMAGED. I HAD A FRIEND LOOK UP MY VIN TO BE SURE IT IS APPLICABLE FOR MY VEHICLE AND IT IS.*AK
VIN # JF2 BJ65C3 NH903488. NO SUMMARY LISTED FOR ABOV EVEHICLE.  *AK

FRONT RIGHT TIRE COMPLETELY FELL OFF THE WHEEL WHILE I WAS DRIVING ON THE FREEWAY.  THE TIRES HAD ONLY BEEN PUT ON 6 MONTHS PRIOR, AND THEY WERE NOT BALD.  MY CAR SPUN OUT OF CONTROL, AND MY HUB CAP ROLLED OUT INTO THE MIDDLE OF THE FREEWAY, CAUSING A CAR TO HIT THE BACK OF A CAR IN FRONT OF IT.  THE TIRE LOOKS AS THOUGH IT HAD BEEN PEELED OFF OF THE WHEEL.  I'M SCARED TO DRIVE THE CAR NOW.*AK (DOT NUMBER: 1857014  TIRESIZE: FT70C 87S)

WHILE STOPPING AT A TRAFFIC SIGNAL ALL OF  ELECTRICAL FUNCTIONS  STOPPED, AND VEHICLE STOPPED OPERATING. A BLACK FUSE CABLE IN FUSE BOX, FUSE LINK: 82301GA060 BURNED UP, AND BURNED A MARK ON  COVER OF  FUSE BOX.  *AK   *SLC
INTERMITTENTLY DRIVER AND PASSENGER RESTRAINTS BECOME  INOPERABLE.*AK

ENGINE STALLS WHEN GOING UPHILL, BACKFIRES, PINGS AND COME TO A STOP.  APPEARS TO HAPPEN WHEN ENGINE IS UNDER VERY MODEST STRAIN.  MORE LIKELY TO HAPPEN ON COLD ENGINE BUT NOT NEARLY ALL THE CASE.  CAN'T TELL IF CHOKE IS IMPLEMENTED FOR SOME REASON.*AK
DRIVER'S SIDE MOTOR BELT FAILED TO OPERATE, LEAVING DRIVER WITHOUT ANY RESTRAINT WHILE DRIVING. DEALER/MANUFACTURER WERE NOT CONTACTED AT THIS TIME.  *AK

WHEN ACCELERATING OR BACKING UP I NOTICED THE CAR WAS SLUGGISH.  WHEN THE HOOD WAS POPPED, THE PART HOLDING THE CRANKSHAFT PULLEY IN PLACE HAD ALMOST FALLEN OFF.  IT TOOK QUIT A WHILE TO OBTAIN THE PART NEEDED.  THE DEALERSHIP WHERE I PURCHASED THE PART IMFORMED ME THAT THIS WAS A PROBLEM FOR THE 92 MODEL AS WELL AS EITHER THE 91 OR 93 MODEL.  MY MECHANIC BUILT A BRACE TO KEEP THE CRANKSHAFT PULLEY FROM FALLING OFF.  THE DEALERSHIP CLAIMED NO RESPONSIBILITY AND I WAS TOLD THE PART HAD NOT BEEN RECALLED. *AK
FUEL TANK ASSEMBLY FILLER, NOT MADE FROM STAINLESS STEEL, HAS ROTTED OUT, CAUSING FUEL TO LEAK .PLEASE PROVIDE FURTHER INFORMATION.  *AK

THE AUOTMATIC SEAT BELT WAS REPLACED LAST APRIL 1999 AND FAILED AGAIN. WE ALSO REPLACED THE PASSENGER SIDE SEATBELT 11/1999.  WE WOULD LIKE ASSISTANCE FROM THE MANUFACTURER WITH THE DRIVER'S SEAT BELT AS IT WAS PROVIDE THROUGH A MANUFACTURER. DEALER AGREEMENT WITH EACH PARTY PAYING $250 TO REPLACE IT THE 1ST TIME.  THERE HAS ONLY BEEN 7,800 MILES SINCE THE LAST BELT WAS REPAIRED. ALSO WE KEEP HAVING TO REPLACE THE SUNVISOR WHICH OF COURSE FAILED WHEN YOU NEED THEM THE MOST. THIS IS VERY UNSAFE.  WE HAVE REPLACED 6 OF THEM. *AK
I HAVE SPENT $60 EACH TIME TO REPLACE SUN VISORS THAT APPEAR TO BE MANUFACTURER'S DEFECT.  PLEASE IMPROVE THE SUN VISORS THIS IS A SAFEY ISSUE AND COULD LEAD INJURIES.  *AK
PASSENGER'S SHOULDER SEATBELT DOES NOT RETRACT WHICH WON'T PROPERLY RESTRAIN THE OCCUPANT IN EVENT OF A CRASH.  PLEASE PROVIDE FURTHER INFORMATION.  *AK
WHEN CONSUMER STARTED UP VEHICLE  MOTORIZED SEAT BELT STARTED WORKING, BUT EVENTUALLY DID NOT WORK AT ALL. *AK

WHEN DRIVING THERE WAS A LOUD KNOCKING NOISE COMING FROM THE FRONT OF THE VEHICLE.  ALSO,  THE VEHICLE WILL FREEZE UP ON THE ROAD,  AND WHEN IN THIRD/FOURTH AND FIFTH GEAR CAN HEAR THE KNOCKING NOISE.  *AK
DRIVER SIDE SUNVISOR HAS CEASED TO FUNCTION. WILL NO LONGER RATCHET UP AND DOWN.  WILL FALL DOWN AND CANNOT BE ADJUSTED.
FRONT SEAT BELT CAME APART.
MOTORBELT FAILED.
CABLE BROKE  ON THE LEFT FRONT  SIDE OF THE DRIVER'S PASSIVE RESTRAINTS.  THE DEALER HAS BEEN NOTIFIED.  *AK
MOTORBELT ON DRIVER'S SIDE FAILS TO RETRACT.
LEFT FRONT SEAT BELT FAILURE
SEATBELT AND RAIL ASSEMBLY FAILURE.
SAFETY BELT FAILED.
DRIVER'S SIDE SHOULDER RESTRAINT FAILED .
SEAT BELT RETRACTOR FAILED.

VEHICLE WAS INVOLVED IN A REAREND COLLISION WHICH RESULTED IN VEHICLE SLAMMING INTO ANOTHER VEHICLE, CAUSING DIRECT FRONTAL DAMAGE, AND THERE WAS NO DEPLOYMENT OF DRIVERS SIDE AIRBAG, CAUSE HAS NOT BEEN DETERMINED.*AK *JB

WHILE DRIVING, EXPERIENCED TIRE BLOW OUT, REPLACED TIRE WITH TEMPORARY (T-TIRE), DROVE APPROX. 20 MILES TO NEAREST GARAGE AT 45MPH, AS DIRECT RESULT FROM USING T-TIRE, NOTICED RUBBER BURNING SMELL,  REAR DIFFERENTIAL SEVERLY OVERHEATED, CAUSING DAMAGE TO REAR AXEL.  *AK
BRAKE FAILURE.

MANUAL 5-SPEED TRANSMISSION LOCKED UP WHILE A RIGHT HAND TURN OUT OF PARKING LOT AND SHIFTING FROM 1ST TO 2ND GEAR.  WITHOUT WARNING THE FRONT WHEELS LOCKED, VEHICLE WA STHROWN INTO A SKID AND BROUGHT IT TO A COMPLETE STOP.  *AK
SEAT BELT COMES ACROSS NECK.
CRANKSHAFT REPLACED.
CRANKSHAFT REPLACED.
SEAT BELT LOCK UP.
POOR SUSPENSION.
TO AVOIDING IMPACT DRIVER RAN OFF THE ROAD HITTING A TELEPHONE POLE,   AIR BAG DID NOT  DEPLOY,  PLEASE DESCRIBE DETAILS. *AK
REAR HATCH RUSTED, PREFVENTING IT FROM BEING RECLOSED ONCE OPENED.   *AK
HOOD LATCH FAILED TO STAY LOCKED. *AK
DRIVER'S DOOR LATCH FAILED, MAKING IT IMPOSSIBLE TO EXIT VEHICLE FROM INTERIOR/INABILITY TO LOCK OR UNLOCK THE VEHICLE WITH A KEY.  *AK
BOTH FRONT AUTOMATIC RESTRAINT SEATBELTS ARE BROKEN AND DO NOT MOVE UP OR DOWN THE TRACK.PLEASE DESCRIBE.    *AK
'KNOCK SENSOR' FAILED TWICE, CAUSING 'CHECK ENGINE' WARNING LIGHT TO COME ON. *DH
MOTORIZED SAFETY BELTS FAILED INTERMITTENTLY.   *AK
ENGINE SURGES INTERMITTENTLY. *DH
WHEN YOU STOP THE AUTO WILL SHOOT FORWARD-THE RPM'S WILL SUDDENLY ACCELERATE AND THE AUTO TAKES OFF.  *AK
REAR LIGHT LENSES CRACKED.   *AK
REAR LIGHT LENSES CRACKED.   *AK
DRIVER'S AND PASSENGER'S SIDE SEAT BELT FAILURE, UNABLE TO LATCH SEAT BELT *AK
DRIVER'S SEAT BELT FAILED.  *SKD
DRIVER SEAT BELT FAILS TO RETRACT. PLEASE DESCRIBE DETAILS.  TT
WINDOW REPLACED DUE TO LEAK. *SD
REAR SEAT BELT SWITCH FAILED. *SD
REPLACED ANTENNA 3 TIMES
METAL ON VEHICLE IS VERY THIN, CAUSING BUMPER/TAILGATE AND FLOOR PAN TO BE CRUSHED DURING AN ACCIDENT.
MISALIGNMENT, CAUSING TIRE TO BLOW OUT.  *AK
QUESTIONS THICKNESS OF  METAL IN BODY OF  CAR. *DSH
IN COLD, WET WEATHER THE FRONT WINDSHEILD DEFROSTER DON'T CLEAR THE WINDOW CLEAR.  TT
NOISE COMING FROM WINDSHIELD AFTER 4 REPAIR ATTEMPTS.  *AW
METAL BODY OF VEHICLE IS TOO THIN, CAUSING EXTENSIVE DAMAGE TO VEHICLE IN A MINOR ACCIDENT.  *AW
STEERING TOO SENSITIVE. *SD
BRAKE PEDAL DESIGNED TO CLOSE TO ACCELERATOR PEDAL, CAUSING THEM TO BE DEPRESSED SIMULANTEOUSLY. *SD
UPON APPLYING BRAKES VEHICLE ACCELERATED OUT OF CONTROL.  *AW
